DIV1.HEAD: A SALE of His MAJESTIES Prize Goods by the Arms of Rotterdam, to be made at the East-India-House, on Thurs∣day the 14th. of May 1674, at Eight of the Clock in the Morning; the particulars are, VIZ.

LIST.HEAD: To reduce them to yards, by the Measure that is upon each piece; and to allow a yard upon a piece; or to measure them, and al∣low nothing.
LIST.ITEM: 1 Case, No. 125 Containing 7 pcs. Scarlet, from No. 1, to 7, cont. 229 yards, or thereabouts; at 13 s. per yard, to advance 2 d. per yard, in 1 Lott.
1 Case, No. 128 Cont. 7 pcs. Crimson, from No. 22, to 28, cont. 234 yards, or thereabouts; at 12 s. per yard, to advance 2 d. per yard, in 1 Lott.
1 Case, No. 132 Cont. 7 pcs. Crimson, from No. 50, to 56, cont. 209 yards, or thereabouts; at 8 s. per yard, to advance 2 d. per yard, in 1 Lott
1 Case, No. 133 Cont. 7 pcs. Red Cloth, from No. 57, to 63, cont. 223 yards, or thereabouts, at 7 s. per yard, to advance 1 d.
3 Remanants 9 Cont. 41 yards of Scatlet and Crimson, at 10 s. per yard, to advance 2 d.
2 Small Cases of Amber at 5 s. per l. to advance 1 d.
180 Barrels of Mum,50 50 50 30 Brown Hollands Beer, or what it is, at 13 s. 4 d. per barr. to advance 2 d. in 4 Lotts
10 Leadgers and 1 Punch of Spanish Wine,3 No. 1, 2, 3, or what it is, at 19 l. per 236 gall. in 3 Lotts,4 No. 4, 5, 6, 7, advance 4 s. per Ton
8 Leadgers of Rhenish Wine,3 No. 8, 9, 10, 11 a punch. at 5 l. per Aume, in 2 Lotts, to advance 12 d.4 No. 1, 2, 3, 4, 4 No. 5, 6, 7, 8.
21 Punchons of Vinegar, at 12 l. per Ton, in 1 Lott, advance 2 s:
5 Rundlets of Rack, at 16 d. per gall. in 1 Lott, at 1 d.
4. Firkins of Butter in barrels of Pickle, at 23 s. per Firkin, 1 Lott, to advance 6 d.
15 Rundlets of Oyle, at 2 s. per gall. in 1 Lott, ro advance 1 d.
1 Chest, No. 135, cont. 220 New Testaments of the Malaw Language, at 12 d. each, in 1 Lott, advance 1 d.
1 Chest, No. 134, cont. 6 Bundles of Small Books, and 283 Prayer-Books, at 6 l. 13 s. 8 d. to advance 6 d.
1 Chest, cont. 150 bundles of Rushes, at 3 d. per bundle, advance 1/4.
10 Drum hhds. and 1 butt of Pruens, at 7 s. per Cent. Tare 84 l. per hhd. and 1 C. per butt, to advance 1 d.
2 Terces of Glew at 16 s. per Cent. Tare 70 l. each, to advance 2 d.
3 Rundlets of Spruce Beer, cont. 40 gall. or thereabouts, at 2 s. 6 d. per gall. to advance 1 d.
2 Cases of Isonglass, cont. about 1 C. 0, 13, at 3 s. 6 d. per l. to advance 1 d.

LIST.HEAD: In 1 Lott, to advance 1 q. on each Parcel, as they stand.
LIST.ITEM:
1 Chest of Coopers Tools, cont. as solloweth,
47 Round Shaves, at 8 d. each,
42 Howells, at 6 d. each,
16 doz. of Percers, at 3 s. per doz.
5 Boxes of Gilt Leaf, 4 s. per Box,

LIST.HEAD: In 1 Lott, to advance 2 d. each paracel.
LIST.ITEM: 2 Chests, cont. 100 Iron Plates, at 18 s. per C.
20 Tew Irons cast for Bellowes, at 4 s. per C.
5 Beak Irons for Smiths, at 20 s. per C.
1 Pair Woodden Screws, at 20 s.

LIST.HEAD: In 1 Lott, to advance 12 d. per C.
LIST.ITEM: 23 Copper Kettles, at 5 l. 10 s. per C
21 Copper Plates or bottoms, at 5 l. per C.

LIST.HEAD: In 1 Lott, to advance 1 d. upon each price.
LIST.ITEM: 6 Doz. and 3 p. of Pinchers, at 3 s. per doz.
2 Drills, at 2 s. 6 d each
8 Doz. and 4 small Brushes, at 1 s. 6 d. per doz.
13 Doz. Carpenters Brass Compasses, with Iron points, at 10 s. per doz.
3 Iron Collars for Turners, at 3 s. each
36 Handvices, at 12 d. each
30 Brass Cocks at 12 d. each
30 Small Cabbin Bells, at 9 d. per l.

LIST.HEAD: In 1 Lott. to advance 1 d. upon each.
LIST.ITEM:
1 Chest, No. 2 of Sea Compasses, &c.
2 Doz. and 1 Sea Compasses at 30 s. per doz.
2 Boxes, cont. 34 Square Glasses for Compasses, at 1 s. 6 d. per doz.
1 Box, cont. 6 doz. Cards for Compasses, 4 s. per doz.
1 Box, cont. 18 Round Glasses for Compasses, 12 d. per doz.

1 Chest, No. 3. cont.
2 Doz. Sea Compasses, at 30 s. per doz.
46 Half-hour Glasses, at 4 d. each
16 Round Glasses, at 12 d. per doz.

LIST.HEAD: all at 31 s. to advance 6 d.
LIST.ITEM: 1 Chest of Cardis
1 Chest of Wormwood
1 Cask Roots in Sand
4 Empty Cases lined with Sheet Lead
